verses.verse: My son<WH1121>, if thou wilt receive<WH3947> my words<WH561>, and hide<WH6845> my commandments<WH4687> with thee;
So that thou incline<WH7181> thine ear<WH241> unto wisdom<WH2451>, and apply<WH5186> thine heart<WH3820> to understanding<WH8394>;
Yea, if thou criest<WH7121> after knowledge<WH998>, and liftest up<WH5414> thy voice<WH6963> for understanding<WH8394>;
If thou seekest<WH1245> her as silver<WH3701>, and searchest<WH2664> for her as for hid treasures<WH4301>;
Then shalt thou understand<WH995> the fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068>, and find<WH4672> the knowledge<WH1847> of God<WH430>.
For the LORD<WH3068> giveth<WH5414> wisdom<WH2451>: out of his mouth<WH6310> cometh knowledge<WH1847> and understanding<WH8394>.
He layeth up<WH6845><WH6845> sound wisdom<WH8454> for the righteous<WH3477>: he is a buckler<WH4043> to them that walk<WH1980> uprightly<WH8537>.
He keepeth<WH5341> the paths<WH734> of judgment<WH4941>, and preserveth<WH8104> the way<WH1870> of his saints<WH2623>.
Then shalt thou understand<WH995> righteousness<WH6664>, and judgment<WH4941>, and equity<WH4339>; yea, every good<WH2896> path<WH4570>.

Discretion<WH4209> shall preserve<WH8104> thee, understanding<WH8394> shall keep<WH5341> thee:
To deliver<WH5337> thee from the way<WH1870> of the evil<WH7451> man, from the man<WH376> that speaketh<WH1696> froward things<WH8419>;
Who leave<WH5800> the paths<WH734> of uprightness<WH3476>, to walk<WH3212> in the ways<WH1870> of darkness<WH2822>;

To deliver<WH5337> thee from the strange<WH2114> woman<WH802>, even from the stranger<WH5237> which flattereth<WH2505> with her words<WH561>;
Which forsaketh<WH5800> the guide<WH441> of her youth<WH5271>, and forgetteth<WH7911> the covenant<WH1285> of her God<WH430>.
For her house<WH1004> inclineth<WH7743> unto death<WH4194>, and her paths<WH4570> unto the dead<WH7496>.
None that go<WH935> unto her return again<WH7725>, neither take they hold<WH5381> of the paths<WH734> of life<WH2416>.
That thou mayest walk<WH3212> in the way<WH1870> of good<WH2896> men, and keep<WH8104> the paths<WH734> of the righteous<WH6662>.
For the upright<WH3477> shall dwell<WH7931> in the land<WH776>, and the perfect<WH8549> shall remain<WH3498> in it.
But the wicked<WH7563> shall be cut off<WH3772> from the earth<WH776>, and the transgressors<WH898> shall be rooted out<WH5255> of it.
